cyclone.name: NICHOLAS
cyclone.current_location: about 180 mi NNE of Veracruz, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest across the western Gulf, then turning north toward the south-central Texas coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: between Port O’Connor and Matagorda Bay, TX (south-central Texas coast)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Port Aransas to High Island, Texas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of the Rio Grande to Port Aransas, Texas (tropical-storm warning) ; Mouth of the Rio Grande to High Island (storm-surge watch)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Texas coastline from the mouth of the Rio Grande through the upper Texas coast, including Freeport, Galveston and into southwest Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (sustained 39–58 mph, higher gusts) possible Monday night into Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft surge possible in Brazoria County coast and within Freeport’s harbor approaches
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches with locally higher amounts (up to 15 inches) likely, creating flash-flood risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents, minor coastal flooding at high tide, isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands
